dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elizabeth is tying Barney's bow tie. Peggy is sitting wit jacket on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's Peggy Sue going to do at your lodge meeting?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's her 18th birthday, I want to show her off. Barney turns and winks at Peggy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was my idea, Grandma. I always wondered what went on at those lodge meetings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He won't tell me, but I've got my suspicions. And I don't want any of that. Don't keep her out late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hugging Elizabeth)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GoodВ—bye, Grandma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have a good time. Barney and Peggy open the door and exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peggy and Barney approach the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does Grandma think you do at your meetings?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stag movies. Smokers. Peggy chuckles as they get into the car. The car proceeds along the driveway and turns onto the highway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barney is at the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I may be an old fool, but I think we can help you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope so. At least I got to see you and Grandma. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Has it ever worked before?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The last one was six hundred years ago. It's about time for another one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A oneВ—story, pitchВ—roof building. The sign over the ent reads.: THE ORDER OF THE GOLDEN DAWN. Underneath the sign a logo of a spreading sunrise. Peggy and Barney pull up t the front, exit the car and enter the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirty old men are congregating around the cloak room. Mo are already dressed in long, purple robes with the sunris logo over their hearts. They either wear or carry triВ—co hats. Peggy and Barney enter. Several men approach them. Peggy nervously clings to Barney' s arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome, Peggy Sue. It's nice to have you with us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, you're a lucky girl. You could lay a bear trap in the aisle of the cathedral and never catch a better man than your grandfather.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah... thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me take your jacket, Lilla. I've got, to get my robe. Peggy hands him her jacket as he heads over to the cloak, room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, this is very exciting for all of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've been waiting a long time for someone like you. Barney rejoins them, wearing his hat and robe. The group begins to enter the main room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervous)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have to wear that hat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wouldn't be a lodge without hats. Barney takes her hand and squeezes it. They walk slowly through the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you worry. I'll be watching after you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large meeting hall. The room is draped, and brightly li with fluorescent lights. At one end sits a large, goldВ— painted wood throne. On either side are large candle hold with lit candles. A small table serves as an altar in fro of the platform. On a footstool is a potted plane with an artificial bird perched on its top. The throne and altar like a set left over from a summer stock "Macbeth". Peggy and Barney enter. Several men lead Peggy away from Barney to the throne. One man places a go1den cape around shoulders. They lead her up the platform to the throne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, George. Get the lights. The LIGHTS are DIMMED. The room is lit by the candles. The men form a semiВ—circle around Peggy. Old men at the of their lives, they are serious and passionate about the possibilities of life beyond this world. One by one, four from either end of the line approach the altar with offerings: a cup of wine; an egg; a gold coin; and a rose The men rejoin the line. LEO COOPER, a tall, whiteВ—haired man, takes two steps forward. The other men begin to sing a Gregorian chant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Peggy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you ready, dear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. Leo steps back, closes his eyes and spreads his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fasten your seat belts. Here we go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lord of the Universe, Vast and Mighty One. Ruler of Light, King of~ the sun. Creator of earth, air, fire and water. (kneeling down)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We adore thee and invoke thee! Grant thine aid. Look with favor upon us as we witness the regeneration of man. We behold the innocent endeavors of singleВ—minded men and women. For we are the company of unbodied souls and immortal angels. We ask thy intervention, that this girl may return to thee on the wings of your Love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is never going to work. The old men form a circle in front of Peggy. They begin t circumambulate east to west, intoning together, their hea bowed. As Barney passes in front of Peggy, he winks at he She smiles back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fount of life, Chariot of the Spirit, Womb of the Mother, reclaim thy child of light. We HEAR a clap of distant THUNDER. Peggy trembles. The artificial bird falls off the plant. Peggy is struck with amazement. She begins to glow, poised to take off. The me continue to chant while:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The name of your love is sacrifice. We offer up this girl, that her soul may find its home. Suddenly a door is opened, a gust of wind pours in and extinguishes the candles, plunging the hall into darkness

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing to worry about. Somebody get the lights. The LIGHTS are TURNED ON. All the men look to the throne. Peggy is gone. They are speechless for a couple of beats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (chipper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, the girl's gone. Let's play some poker. CLOSE ON BARNEY В— He smiles, happy that she made it. Geo crosses to the wall, reaches behind the drapes and presse button. The wall slides open to reveal a fullyВ—equipped room. The men shuffle in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie carries Peggy off towards his car, one hand cover her mouth. Peggy struggles. When they reach the car, he p her down. She's still wrapped in her golden robe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell did you do that for? What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was trying to save you. They were going to vaporize you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be ridiculous! They're just a bunch of harmless old men. My grandfather was in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to listen to me. Charlie tries to Lead Peggy into the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not getting in that blue monstrosity. Charlie pushes her inside, Peggy climbs back out. Charlie takes her hand and drags her up a hill behind the lodge h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me got! Where are you taking me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right here. Now sit down. Charlie sits her down on the ground. She's impatient and hopping mad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look. I wanna tell you. I forgive you for everything. I know what you've been going through. You're just scared. I was scared, too, but I'm not anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could you possibly know what I've been going through? Thunder and lightning. It starts to rain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I love you, damnit! I had a long talk with your father yesterday and we decided that the best thing for us to do is get married and settle down. Right away. Peggy jumps up, exploding to Charlie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean you and my father decided? Who the hell are you to plan my life? Let's get married and live happily ever after. Bullshit. I got knocked up. I had to marry you. I never had a choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You betrayed me, Charlie. You were never there for me or the children. And now you come and tell me, "Peggy, you're scared." Of course I'm scared. If you knew what I knew you'd be scared shitless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're crazy! You're really out of your mind!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I might be crazy, but I'm not crazy enough to marry you twice. There's a lot of things I can't change. I can't even think about them. I tried. But I couldn't even help Rosalie. (tears start)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to be bitter. I'm a naturally optimistic person. But you took advantage of that. Charlie bends down to comfort her, in tears. He hugs Pegg and strokes her hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Peggy. My poor Peggy. It's all my fault. I'm so sorry. I won't bother you anymore. I promise. Please stop crying. Please. Peggy starts to compose herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you take me back to my grandparents?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. Charlie helps her up. Be reaches into his pocket and take out a small box, handing it to Peggy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's almost your birthday. I wasn't sure when you were coming back, so I brought your present up here. With a slow, growing remembrance, Peggy opens the box. In is the gold locket Peggy was wearing at the reunion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (anguished)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Charlie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It opens, too. Look inside. Peggy opens the locket. She shivers with recognition.

dialogues.speaker: LOCKET
dialogues.text: Two photos, one of Peggy, one of Charlie, as children.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scott and Beth. Where did you get these?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's Scott and Beth? Your mother gave me our picture. That's you and me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So are Scott and Beth. Peggy leans into Charlie, throwing her arms around him, holding on for dear life. She looks up at him, their foreheads touching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tenderly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. Charlie kisses her, passionately. The locket drops to the ground. HOLD on the locket, and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie and Peggy are lying on the ground, gazing up. A f of lightning streaks across the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we should get out of here. It's going to rain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (musing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think anybody in the Fifties ever made love on a bed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is that? Flying high above them is an enormous, glowing, liquid ne kite. The center of the kite inscribed in lights, flashin like a marquee: HAPPY BIRTHDAY PEGGY SUE. The kite begins to descend towards them. Peggy jumps to h feet and races towards it. She grabs the tail and starts sail away with the kite. Charlie chases after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peggy! Where're you going? Come back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got to go now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I love you. I'll love you forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll love you, too, Charlie. I'll love you for twenty years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come back to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm trying. As Charlie watches helplessly, a huge bolt of lightning strikes his car. Peggy smiles. The men from the lodge run outside. They look up and above the blazing car and see P floating away. Peggy sees her grandfather in the crowd an blows him a kiss. Charlie begins to run, following the ki cord to its source. He finds Richard, struggling to restr the runaway kite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard, do something!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't! It's out of control! Suddenly the cord breaks. Peggy floats away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peggy! Charlie, Richard and the old men behold Peggy, bobbing an dipping playfully in the sky. We begin to HEAR Charlie's VOICE singing "Peggy Sue" O.S. Peggy looks down with wond at the earth, and then like a comet, soars into the blackness. In an instant she becomes a star.

dialogues.speaker: HOSPITAL ROOM
dialogues.text: Moving from two to C.U. Peggy, fragments of the reunion, cake coming towards her, fragments of words in echo effec 'Your heart stopped for a while..." Father's voice: 'You're a very lucky young lady...' Doctor: 'A (explain) the head...' Mom's voice: 'But you're going to be all rig now, the paramedics got there...' Mom, 'We were so worried..." Echoing of, until once voice is left. Charlie. Sitting opposite her bed, as he has been every minute of her illn He looks wan and old, worried sick, but trying to sing 'P Sue' for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing softly). Peggy Sue, I love you, and I need you Peggy Sue...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie? Was I dead?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you were...for a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (affectionately)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look awful, like you haven't slept in days. And so old.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But happy. Very happy, Peggy Sue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie, I thought I knew everything about you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted to apologize. I can't live without you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Janet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's over. I got tired of translating everything. She thought the Big Hopper was a hamburger. Charlie laughs uncomfortably and Peggy Sue looks around h hospital room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are all the flowers from? Charlie pushes himself out of his chair and moves toward dresser.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone.  Maddie and Arthur, Carol and Walter. Richard Norvick.  And here's a book, by that guy from high school, Michael Fitzsimmons.  He dedicated it to you. Charlie returns to Peggy's bedside and opens the front co of the book. ANGLE ON BOOK: the front page bears the title "The Pilgri Soul" and the dedication reads "to Peggy Sue and a Starry Night". Peggy smiles but shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It couldn't be me.  I hardly knew him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll just set it right here. He places the book on her bedside table as he sits back d

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie, I had a strange experience.  I went back to high school. And I spent a lot of time with you.  And you and Walter and Leon were singing "I Wonder Why".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, God, Dion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were terrific.  And I kept trying to push you away but you wouldn't give up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll never give up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then hold me. He holds her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I loved you since the day I met you, and I haven't stopped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't try to charm me, Charlie Bodell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, I don't expect all the troubles between us can just vanish away. But I would do what I can...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie, please, I need some time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'll let you get some rest...so long. The VIEW PULLS BACK past the flowers. Charlie starts to e Checks himself in the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie, I would like to invite you to dinner at home, on Sunday, with your kids. I will make a strudel. He hurries back to her, kisses her again. They hang on to each other as Beth enters the room.

dialogues.speaker: PEGGY AND RICHARD SCENE
dialogues.text: To be inserted after Dolores/Peggy scene and to replace t goodbye to Richard scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Empty except for Richard who sits alone in a study warren surrounded by books. Peggy approaches. Be puts down the b he's reading. He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, Peggy, there's so many things to look forward to in the future. Peggy leans over and kisses him, sadly, on the forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I came to say goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye? Where're you going? What about our partnership? I'm making real progress with the microchip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were meant to  You're one of those fortunate people that good things happen to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So are you. You've got a vision.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (manic)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vision? I'm a walking anachronism! I've upset my parents. I miss my kids. I could be trapped here forever! And poor Charlie...I got pregnant on my 18th birthday and we had to get married. Tomorrow's my birthday! I've got to get out of here now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you break up with Charlie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah. I'm taking a big gamble. I've loved him for a long, long time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Why don't we do something visionary. Change your destiny, Peggy Sue. Change your destiny and marry me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slamming down book)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! No! No! Peggy Sue got married! Case closed. I don't want to marry anybody. Goodbye Richard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait! I'll go with you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't. You're going to be Valedictorian.
